designations.source: A review of the beetles of Great Britain: The Darkling Beetles and their allies
designations.source_description: This report was commissioned to update the threat status of Darkling beetles  from work originally undertaken in 1987, 1992 and 1994 using the IUCN methodology for assessing threat. designations.reporting_category: Red listing based on 2001 IUCN guidelines
designations.designation_description: Category for a taxon when there is no reasonable doubt that the last individual potentially capble of reproduction within the region has died or has disappeared from the wild in the region, or when, if it is a former visiting taxon, the last individual has died or disappeared in the wild from the region. The setting of any time limit for listing under RE is left to the discretion of the regional Red List authority, but should not normally pre-date 1500 AD.
designations.comments: The beetle was common in the Orlestone Forest area from the late 1950s to the early 1960s, where it was last seen in 1963. It is difficult to find a reason why this beetle should have come and gone like that (Philp, 2002). It was apparently never seen again at Blean, after 1948. The only New Forest records were those of 1936 and 1938. It seems likely that the species colonized southern England from the near Continent temporarily and then became extinct.
